conclusion: An object A with mass 2m is connected to an object B with mass 3m on the ground via a light spring with a spring constant k. An inextensible light rope passes over a fixed pulley, with one end connected to object A and the other end connected to an object C with mass m. Objects A, B, and C are all in a state of rest. The gravitational acceleration is g, and all friction is neglected.

Change the mass of object C to 5m. At this point, C slowly descends, and after some time, the system reaches a new equilibrium state. At this time, B still does not leave the ground, and C is only subjected to gravity and the tension of the rope.
Object A has mass 2m, object B has mass 3m, and object C has mass m. A spring connects objects A and B. A rope passes over a pulley connecting objects A and C.

premise: Object C with mass m is balanced by the tension in the rope.
conclusion: The tension in the rope is T = mg.

premise: The spring is stretched to balance the difference in forces between object A and object C.
Object B with mass 3m has gravitational force 3mg and is balanced by the spring force.
Object C with mass 5m is balanced by the tension in the rope.
conclusion: New tension in the rope T = 5mg.

premise: The spring is stretched to balance the difference in forces between object A and object C.
Object B remains on the ground and does not move.
Initial spring force F_{k1} = mg and spring constant k.
New spring force F_{k2} = 2mg and spring constant k.
Initial compression x_1 = mg/k and new compression x_2 = 2mg/k.
Change in compression Δx = -mg/k and additional movement from the rope (5mg - 2mg).

conclusion: The height that object A rises during this process is 4mg/k.
